member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.XmlConfigData.FieldList
member.summary: Returns the field definitions as XML. The definition includes field names, data types, XPath and more, including data list values.
member.remarks: See WorkArea\ewebeditpro\DesignToFieldList.xslt for an example.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormRequestData.Id
member.summary: The numeric ID of the form.
member.returns: The numeric ID (Long) of the form.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormRequestData.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the form's language ID. For example, 1033 for English, 1034 for Spanish or 1036 for French. When set to 0 (zero), the language is dynamic.
member.returns: The form's language ID as an integer.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormRequestData.TagRequired
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to wrap form tags around the form element. * True - wrap form tags around the form element. * False - Do not wrap form tags around the form element.
member.remarks: Typically set to false.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormRequestData.PostBackData
member.summary: Gets or sets the data submitted from the form as a collection.
member.returns: System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormRequestData.IsPoll
member.summary: Gets whether the form is used as poll. * True - this form is a poll. * False - this form is not a poll.
member.remarks: This should only be read not set.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormRequestData.PreFillFielddata
member.summary:
Gets or sets the data values that are used to pre-fill a form's fields. When you display a form, this is the information pre-loaded into each field.
For example, in a Country: field you might have "United States" set to pre-fill the field. This way, people from the United States don't have to type it in each time. Another example is when a user is logged in and fills out a form more that once, his name and and email address always appear in their respective fields after completing the form the first time.
member.remarks: If the AutoFill property is set to false, this property appears as empty.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormRequestData.FieldList
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of the fields defined in the form.
member.returns: Ektron.Cms.FormFieldList

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormRequestData.AutoFill
member.summary: Indicates whether a form's fields are pre-filled when the form is displayed. * True - a form's fields are pre-filled when the form is displayed. * False - a form's fields are empty when the form is displayed.

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.FormRequestData
member.summary: A data object that contains information about a form.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldList.Fields
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of field definitions.
member.returns: Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDefinition

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldList.Datalists
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of defined datalists.
member.returns: Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalist

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldList
member.summary: Describes the definition of all the fields in a specific form.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDefinition.FieldName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field.
member.remarks: The name is suitable for machine processing, such as with an XML parser.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDefinition.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field to be displayed.
member.remarks: The name is suitable for human reading.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDefinition.Datatype
member.summary: Gets or sets the datatype of the field.
member.remarks: The possible values of the datatype vary. Generally they conform to W3C XML Schema types such as 'string' and 'date'. Other values include 'selection' and 'choice'.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDefinition.Basetype
member.summary: Gets or sets the basic datatype of the field.
member.remarks: The possible values of the basic datatype vary, including, text, textbox, calendar and checkbox.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDefinition.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of content allowed within the field. This is loosely associated with the datatype.
member.remarks: The possible values for content vary.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDefinition.XPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the XPath expression that locates the field.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDefinition.DatalistName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the datalist, if one is defined for this field.
member.remarks: Applies only to fields whose values are selected from a list. The allowed values are defined in the datalist.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDefinition.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the language code of the datalist. For example, en or en-US.
member.remarks: The first two letters of the language code conform to ISO 639. The last two letters are an optional country code that conforms to ISO 3166.

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDefinition
member.summary: Describes the definition of an individual form field.
member.remarks: Typically used as an array in class FormFieldList.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalistItem.DataValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value for this item in the data list.
member.remarks: This value is typically language independent and suitable for machine processing.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalistItem.DisplayValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to be displayed.
member.remarks: This value is typically dependent on the language and suitable for human reading.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalistItem.IsDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this item is the default value in the datalist. Set to True if this item is a default value for the list.
member.remarks: If a list allows only one item to be selected at a time, then only one item should be marked as the default. If more than one may be selected, then it is reasonable to have more than one default.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalistItem.IsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this item is enabled for selection. Set to True if this item is enabled.
member.remarks: An item may be disabled to prevent it from being selected. Typically an item, once defined and used, would not be deleted from the list, but simply disabled. This preserves the display value of the item for backward compatibility.

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalistItem
member.summary: Describes an individual datalist item (most importantly its value and display value).
member.remarks: Typically used as an array in class FormFieldDatalist

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalist.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the datalist.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalist.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the language code of the datalist. For example, en or en-US.
member.returns: Language code.
member.remarks: The first two letters of the language code conform to ISO 639. The last two letters are an optional country code that conforms to ISO 3166.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalist.DatalistItems
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of items defined in the datalist.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalist.DataSrc
member.summary: Gets or sets the Data Source of the pre-defined datalist.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalist.DataSelect
member.summary: Gets or sets the Data Select of the pre-defined datalist.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalist.CaptionXPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the CaptionXPath of the pre-defined datalist.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalist.ValueXPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the Value XPath of the pre-defined datalist.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalist.DataNamespaces
member.summary: Gets or sets the Data Namespace of the pre-defined datalist.

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDatalist
member.summary: Describes an individual datalist suitable as an enumeration for a select list.
member.remarks:
Typically used as an array in class FormFieldList.
Typically referenced by name in class FormFieldDefinition.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDataItem.FieldName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the form field.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDataItem.DataValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the form field.
member.remarks: The data type of the value is variant (i.e., an Object).

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.FormFieldDataItem
member.summary: Describes an instance of a data value from an individual form field. The data is a name/value pair.
member.remarks: Typically, this class is used in an array.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.FolderId
member.summary: Gets or sets the FolderId for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: An existing folder's integer ID.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.FolderName
member.summary: Gets or sets the FolderName for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: An existing folder's name.
member.remarks: Required Field

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.FolderDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder description for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: An existing folder's description.
member.remarks: Required Field

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.ParentId
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder's parent folder ID for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: An existing folder's parent folder ID.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.TemplateFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder's template file for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: An existing folder's template name.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.StyleSheet
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder's style sheet for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: An existing folder's style sheet name.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.SiteMapPathInherit
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the folder's SiteMap path is inherited for the FolderRequest data object.
True = SiteMap path is inherited.
False = SiteMap path is not inherited.
member.returns: True or False depending whether an existing folder's SiteMap path is inherited or not.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.SiteMapPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a folder's SiteMap path for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: An existing folder's SiteMap path.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.ImageDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the physical path to the folder's image directory for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: An existing folder's image directory.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.FileDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the physical path to the folder's file directory for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: An existing folder's file directory.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.DomainStaging
member.summary: Gets or sets the staging domain for the folder when the folder is a domain folder and the site is a staging site. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: The folder's existing staging site domain.
member.remarks: Example: dev.ektron.com

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.DomainProduction
member.summary: Gets or sets the production domain for the folder when the folder is a domain folder and the site is a production site. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: The folder's existing production site domain.
member.remarks: Example: www.ektron.com

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.FolderType
member.summary:
Gets or sets the folder type of the folder. This enumeration is available at Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.FolderType.
Available Types: * 0 = Content - a content folder that contains assets, documents and HTML content. * 1 = Blog - designates the folder for use with the Blogging feature. * 2 = Domain - designates the folder as a domain folder when using the Multi-site feature. * 3 = Discussion Board - designates the folder for use as a Threaded Discussion folder. * 4 = Discussion Forum - a subfolder of the Threaded Discussion folder. * 5 = Root - Specifies a folder as root folder. This option is not available. * 6 = Community - Membership users can add and edit content contained in these folders.
member.returns: The integer value of the folder type.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.IsDomainFolder
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the folder is a domain folder for the FolderRequest data object.
True = designate a folder as a domain folder.
False = folder is not a domain folder.
member.returns: Returns True if the folder is a domain folder.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.XmlInherited
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the XML configuration for the folder is inherited from the parent folder. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
True = inherit the XML configuration from the parent folder.
False = Do not inherit the XML configuration from the parent folder.
member.returns: Returns True if the XML configuration is inherited from the parent folder.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.EnableReplication
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the folder is replicated during Quick Deploy. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
True = replicate the folder during Quick Deploy.
False = Do not replicate the folder during Quick Deploy.
member.returns: Returns True if the folder is replicated during Quick Deploy.
member.remarks: This property is used with the Quick Deploy feature in CMS400.NET. It does not affect Site Replication.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.PublishActive
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether assets in the folder are published in another format. It also determines in which format the assets are published. For example, HTML or PDF. This is for the FolderRequest data object. * PublishPdfActive = publish asset as a PDF.
* PublishHtmlActive = publish asset as HTML. * "" (Empty) - assets in the folder are not published.
member.returns: A string based on whether to publish contents as HTML, PDF or not at all.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.XmlConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets the XML configuration for the folder. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: The existing XML configuration for the folder.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.BreakInheritButton
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether to break the folder's permission inheritance for the FolderRequest data object.
True = break a folder's permission inheritance.
False = Do not break a folder's permission inheritance.
member.returns: Returns True if the folder's permission inheritance is broken.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.FolderCfldAssignments
member.summary: Gets or set a list of metadata assigned to the folder. This is for the FolderRequest data object.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.SubscriptionProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder's Subscriptions properties for the FolderRequest data object.

members.member:
Gets or sets whether to disable Web alerts. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
True = suppress Web Alert notifications.
False = allow Web Alert notifications.
True = suppress Web Alert notifications.
False = allow Web Alert notifications. Default = False, to override this use the BreakInheritance property of the FolderRequest.SubscriptionProperties object (set it to True).
Boolean value. If true, suppress Web Alert notifications. Otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.ContentSubAssignments
member.summary: Gets or sets the folder's content subscription assignments. This is for the FolderRequest data object.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.MetaInherited
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the folder inherits metadata from another folder. The folder ID must be specified in MetaInheritedFrom property. * 1 = inherits metadata from a folder. * 0 = does not inherit metadata from a folder.
member.returns: An integer value representing whether the folder inherits metadata from another folder.
member.remarks: If set to true, the folder ID must be specified in MetaInheritedFrom property.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.MetaInheritedFrom
member.summary: Gets or Sets the folder ID from which metadata is inherited. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: An integer value representing the folder ID
member.remarks: InheritMetadata must be set to 1, otherwise it will be ignored.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.TaxonomyInherited
member.summary:
Set the property to true to inherit taxonomy from a folder. The folder ID must be specified in TaxonomyInheritedFrom property. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
1 = this folder inherits taxonomy from a folder.
0 = this folder does not inherit taxonomy from a folder.
member.returns: An integer value representing whether the folder inherits taxonomy from a folder.
member.remarks: If set to true, the folder ID must be specified in TaxonomyInheritedFrom property.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.TaxonomyInheritedFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets the numeric folder ID from which taxonomy is inherited. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: An integer representing the folder ID from which taxonomy is inherited.
member.remarks: The TaxonomyInherited property must be set to 1 or True, otherwise it will be ignored.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.FlagInherited
member.summary:
Set the property to true to inherit flag from a folder. The folder ID must be specified in flagInheritedFrom property. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
1 = this folder inherits flag from a folder.
0 = this folder does not inherit flag from a folder.
member.returns: An integer value representing whether the folder inherits flag from a folder.
member.remarks: If set to true, the folder ID must be specified in flagInheritedFrom property.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.FlagInheritedFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets the numeric folder ID from which flag is inherited. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: An integer representing the folder ID from which flag is inherited.
member.remarks: The flagInherited property must be set to 1 or True, otherwise it will be ignored.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.CategoryRequired
member.summary: Flag to indicate if a category selection is required while adding/editing content. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: Boolean value. If true, a category selection is required. Otherwise, false

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.TaxonomyIdList
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of taxonomy IDs values separated by comma. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: Comma separated list of taxonomy IDs.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.FlagDefIdList
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of flag definition IDs values separated by comma. This is for the FolderRequest data object.
member.returns: Comma separated list of flag definition IDs.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.ByPassMetadataUpateforFolder
member.summary:
Used only for folders hidden in workarea, if this is set to true ActivateMetadataToFolder is not called. True = Do not call ActivateMetadataToFolder.
False = Call ActivateMetadataToFolder.
member.returns: True or False depending on whether to by pass calling ActivateMetadataToFolder

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.AliasInheritedFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the parent folder from which the alias is inherited. This is for the FolderData object.
member.returns: The integer ID of the parent folder.
member.remarks: The aliasinherited property must be set to True, otherwise it will be ignored.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.AliasInherited
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether alias is inherited from the parent folder. This is for the FolderData object.
True = alias is inherited from the parent folder.
False = alias is not inherited from the parent folder.
member.returns: Returns true if alias is inherited from the parent folder.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.AliasRequired
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether force aliasing selection is required when creating or editing content. This is for the FolderData object.
True = force aliasing is required when creating or editing content.
False = force aliasing is not required when creating or editing content.
member.returns: Returns true if a force aliasing is required when creating of publishing content.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.IsContentSearchableInheritedFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the parent folder from which the IsContentSearchable is inherited. This is for the FolderData object.
member.returns: The integer ID of the parent folder.
member.remarks: The IsContentSearchable property must be set to True, otherwise it will be ignored.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.IsContentSearchableInherited
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether IsContentSearchable is inherited from the parent folder. This is for the FolderData object.
True = IsContentSearchable is inherited from the parent folder.
False = IsContentSearchable is not inherited from the parent folder.
member.returns: Returns true if IsContentSearchable is inherited from the parent folder.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FolderRequest.IscontentSearchable
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether force ContentSearchable selection is required when creating or editing content. This is for the FolderData object.
True = force ContentSearchable is required when creating or editing content.
False = force ContentSearchable is not required when creating or editing content.
member.returns: Returns true if a force ContentSearchable is required when creating of publishing content.

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.EkXml
member.summary: Helper class to make working with XML much easier in the common cases.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkRequestInformation.AuthenticationToken

member.summary: Utility function to simply making text XML safe

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.FormatCurrency(System.Decimal,System.String)
member.summary: Formats the given price based upon the supplied culture code. For example, 10.50, en-Us would result in $10.50.
member.param: price value to format
culture code to format for.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.GetCurrencyCharacter(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a currency character for supplied culture.
member.param: culture code to retrieve currency character for.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.FormatPercent(System.Decimal,System.String)
member.summary: Formats the given percent based upon the supplied culture code. For example, 10.50, en-Us would result in 10.50%.
member.param: percent value to format
culture code to format for.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.HtmlEncode(System.String)
member.summary: HTML encodes &, <, >, and " rather than the more extensive list of characters encoded by .NET. This matches the HtmlEncode() method in ektron.string.js.
member.param: String to encode
member.returns: String encoded for HTML or XML
member.remarks: .NET's HtmlEncode does too much, namely, single-byte special chars (e.g., spanish n), are converted to char ref.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.RemoveHTML(System.String)
member.summary: Returns formatted HTML.
member.param: An unformatted HTML string.
member.returns: String

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.GetTimeLapse(System.DateTime,Ektron.Cms.Common.EkRequestInformation)
member.summary: Gets the time lapse

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.getContentTypeIconAspx(System.Int32,Microsoft.VisualBasic.Collection,System.String)
member.summary: get the icon for the content type
member.param: content type
VB collection contains "ContentSubType" and "ImageUrl" (as its icon path).
application path to locate the icon
member.returns: image tag for the icon

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.CountWords(System.String)
member.summary: Estimates the word count of text with space-delimited words. XML and HTML tags (and their attributes) are excluded. Numbers, punctuation, etc. are included (this is a quick estimate, but not very accurate).
member.param: The text with words to count
member.returns: A rough estimate of the number of words
member.remarks: Returns erroneous results for languages that do not separate words with spaces.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.URLLinkFormat(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Match)
member.summary: If the Match object passed in is a matches the falsePositivePattern Regex, the original match is returned as a string. Otherwise it returns a formatted anchor tag based on the original match.
member.param: The regular expression match to check.
member.returns: The original match as text or an anchor tag based on the match.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.EmailAddressFormat(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Match)
member.summary: Method returns a formated string for a mailto: link
member.param: Match genersated by Regular Expression object
member.returns: mailto anchor tag based on the original Match text.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.ConvertUrls(System.String)
member.summary: Searches through a given string and looks for URLs embedded in the text. Any URLs found are converted to anchor tags based on that URL.
member.param: The string to search for URLs.
member.returns: A string where all URLs have been converted to links based on the URLs found.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.IsValidDMSWhiteListExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Used for checking if the extensions being added by a user in the assetconfig setup are in the master whitelist of extensions in the web.config. The key to change in the web.config is ek_DMSFileTypeWhiteList to add or remove extensions.
member.param: Comma delimited list of extensions to be checked.
member.returns: A boolean of whether or not the list of provided extensions can be added.
member.remarks: If false is returned, suggest looking at what extensions are being added that are not in the whitelist.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkFunctions.IsValidLibWhiteListExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Used for checking if the extensions being added by a user in the library setup are in the master whitelist of extensions in the web.config. The key to change in the web.config is ek_LibFileTypeWhiteList to add or remove extensions.
member.param: Comma delimited list of extensions to be checked.
member.returns: A boolean of whether or not the list of provided extensions can be added.
member.remarks: If false is returned, suggest looking at what extensions are being added that are not in the whitelist.

members.member:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Throws a friendly and helpful error message. Only use this function to process UNEXPECTED errors. To detect unexpected errors, set a break point in this function.
The exception object from the Catch statement (see example). Value Type: (System.Exception)
Example: Try ' Your code here Catch ex as Exception EkException.ThrowException(ex) Finally ' Your code here End Try
Format of message: "ex.Message [AssemblyName.MethodName:line n]"
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.EkException.LogException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Logs the exception to the event log.
member.param: Exception to log.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.EkException.LogException(System.String)
member.summary: Logs the exception to the event log.
member.param: Write Exception message to Event log.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.EkException.LogException(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException)
member.summary: Logs the exception to the event log.
member.param: Exception to write to event log

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.EkException.LogException(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlError)
member.summary: Logs the SqlError to the event log.
member.param: Error to write to event log

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.EkException.LogException(System.Exception,System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType)
member.summary: Logs the exception to the event log using the supplied EventLogEntryType.
member.param: Exception to log.

members.member:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Returns a friendly message showing the module and line number that raised the exception.
The exception object from the Catch statement (see example). Value Type: (System.Exception)
String with the AssemblyName, MethodName and line number. (System.String)
Format of message: " [AssemblyName.MethodName:line n]"
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.EkException.WriteToEventLog(System.String,System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType)
member.summary: Writes the entry (message) to the Application Event Log.
member.param: Message to log into event log
Log entry type [Error | Warning | Information]

member.name: F:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.ActivityActionSource.All
member.summary: Indicates that the user will be notified in all instances - regardless of source.

member.name: F:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.ActivityActionSource.Colleague
member.summary: Indicates the user would only be notified if the activity source is a colleague.

member.name: F:Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.ActivityActionSource.CommunityGroup
member.summary: Indicates the user would only be notified if the activity source is a Community Group the user belongs to.

member.summary: Enumeration of possible Activity Sources that you want to be notified on.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels.FeedbackHeader
member.summary: The label corresponding to how the user would rate the content block. Defaults to "How would you rate the usefulness of this content?".

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels.UserCommentsHeader
member.summary: The label corresponding to why the user rated content the way they did. Defaults to "Tell us why you rated the content this way".

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels.ValidationMessage
member.summary: The label displayed to a user when they try to submit a content rating without selecting a value of 1-9. Defaults to "Please select a rating before submitting your feedback.".

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels.ThankYouMessage
member.summary: The label displayed to a user thanking them for their content rating. Defaults to "Thank you for your feedback.".

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels.GoodLabel
member.summary: The label corresponding to a "Good" content rating. This defaults to "Outstanding".

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels.BadLabel
member.summary: The label corresponding to a "Bad" content rating. This defaults to "Poor".

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels.AlreadyRatedMessage
member.summary: The message displayed to a user when they rate content, but have already rated it. Defaults to "You have already rated this content."

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels.CookiesRequiredMessage
member.summary: The message displayed to a user when they rate content, but they have cookies disabled. Defaults to "We're sorry, but you must enable cookies in your browser to rate this content."

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels.CharsRemainingLabel
member.summary: The label indicating to the user how many more characters they may enter into the 'comments' section of the rating form. Defaults to "Characters Remaining: ".

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels.RatingLevelLabel
member.summary: The label used to indicate the meaning of the rating displayed to the user, e.g. 7.8/9. Defaults to "Rating Level: ".

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels.TotalRatingsLabel
member.summary: The label used to indicate the meaning of the total ratings displayed to the user, e.g. "Total Ratings: 986". Defaults to "Total Ratings: "

member.summary: Provides a convenient data class for getting and setting Content Rating Labels.
